segment.source: Text box
segment.target: Text box

segment.source: The TextBox control lets a user type text into an app.
segment.target: The TextBox control lets a user type text into an app.

segment.source: It's typically used to capture a single line of text, but can be configured to capture multiple lines of text.
segment.target: It's typically used to capture a single line of text, but can be configured to capture multiple lines of text.

segment.source: The text displays on the screen in a simple, uniform, plaintext format.
segment.target: The text displays on the screen in a simple, uniform, plaintext format.

segment.source: TextBox has a number of features that can simplify text entry.
segment.target: TextBox has a number of features that can simplify text entry.

segment.source: It comes with a familiar, built-in context menu with support for copying and pasting text.
segment.target: It comes with a familiar, built-in context menu with support for copying and pasting text.

segment.source: The "clear all" button lets a user quickly delete all text that has been entered.
segment.target: The "clear all" button lets a user quickly delete all text that has been entered.

segment.source: It also has spell checking capabilities built in and enabled by default.
segment.target: It also has spell checking capabilities built in and enabled by default.

segment.source: Important APIs
segment.target: Important APIs

segment.source: TextBox class
segment.target: TextBox class

segment.source: Text property
segment.target: Text property

segment.source: Is this the right control?
segment.target: Is this the right control?

segment.source: Use a TextBox control to let a user enter and edit unformatted text, such as in a form.
segment.target: Use a TextBox control to let a user enter and edit unformatted text, such as in a form.

segment.source: You can use the Text property to get and set the text in a TextBox.
segment.target: You can use the Text property to get and set the text in a TextBox.

segment.source: You can make a TextBox read-only, but this should be a temporary, conditional state.
segment.target: You can make a TextBox read-only, but this should be a temporary, conditional state.

segment.source: If the text is never editable, consider using a TextBlock instead.
segment.target: If the text is never editable, consider using a TextBlock instead.

segment.source: Use a PasswordBox control to collect a password or other private data, such as a Social Security number.
segment.target: Use a PasswordBox control to collect a password or other private data, such as a Social Security number.

segment.source: A password box looks like a text input box, except that it renders bullets in place of the text that has been entered.
segment.target: A password box looks like a text input box, except that it renders bullets in place of the text that has been entered.

segment.source: Use an AutoSuggestBox control to let the user enter search terms or to show the user a list of suggestions to choose from as they type.
segment.target: Use an AutoSuggestBox control to let the user enter search terms or to show the user a list of suggestions to choose from as they type.

segment.source: Use a RichEditBox to display and edit rich text files.
segment.target: Use a RichEditBox to display and edit rich text files.

segment.source: For more info about choosing the right text control, see the Text controls article.
segment.target: For more info about choosing the right text control, see the Text controls article.

segment.source: Examples
segment.target: Examples

segment.source: A text box
segment.target: A text box

segment.source: Create a text box
segment.target: Create a text box

segment.source: Here's the XAML for a simple text box with a header and placeholder text.
segment.target: Here's the XAML for a simple text box with a header and placeholder text.

segment.source: Here's the text box that results from this XAML.
segment.target: Here's the text box that results from this XAML.

segment.source: A simple text box
segment.target: A simple text box

segment.source: Use a text box for data input in a form
segment.target: Use a text box for data input in a form

segment.source: It’s common to use a text box to accept data input on a form, and use the Text property to get the complete text string from the text box.
segment.target: It’s common to use a text box to accept data input on a form, and use the Text property to get the complete text string from the text box.

segment.source: You typically use an event like a submit button click to access the Text property, but you can handle the TextChanged or TextChanging event if you need to do something when the text changes.
segment.target: You typically use an event like a submit button click to access the Text property, but you can handle the TextChanged or TextChanging event if you need to do something when the text changes.

segment.source: You can add a Header (or label) and PlaceholderText (or watermark) to the text box to give the user an indication of what the text box is for.
segment.target: You can add a Header (or label) and PlaceholderText (or watermark) to the text box to give the user an indication of what the text box is for.

segment.source: To customize the look of the header, you can set the HeaderTemplate property instead of Header.
segment.target: To customize the look of the header, you can set the HeaderTemplate property instead of Header.

segment.source: For design info, see Guidelines for labels.
segment.target: For design info, see Guidelines for labels.

segment.source: You can restrict the number of characters the user can type by setting the MaxLength property.
segment.target: You can restrict the number of characters the user can type by setting the MaxLength property.

segment.source: However, MaxLength does not restrict the length of pasted text.
segment.target: However, MaxLength does not restrict the length of pasted text.

segment.source: Use the Paste event to modify pasted text if this is important for your app.
segment.target: Use the Paste event to modify pasted text if this is important for your app.

segment.source: The text box includes a clear all button ("X") that appears when text is entered in the box.
segment.target: The text box includes a clear all button ("X") that appears when text is entered in the box.

segment.source: When a user clicks the "X", the text in the text box is cleared.
segment.target: When a user clicks the "X", the text in the text box is cleared.

segment.source: It looks like this.
segment.target: It looks like this.

segment.source: A text box with a clear all button
segment.target: A text box with a clear all button

segment.source: The clear all button is shown only for editable, single-line text boxes that contain text and have focus.
segment.target: The clear all button is shown only for editable, single-line text boxes that contain text and have focus.

segment.source: The clear all button is not shown in any of these cases:
segment.target: The clear all button is not shown in any of these cases:

segment.source: IsReadOnly is true
segment.target: IsReadOnly is true

segment.source: AcceptsReturn is true
segment.target: AcceptsReturn is true

segment.source: TextWrap has a value other than NoWrap
segment.target: TextWrap has a value other than NoWrap

segment.source: Make a text box read-only
segment.target: Make a text box read-only

segment.source: You can make a text box read-only by setting the IsReadOnly property to true.
segment.target: You can make a text box read-only by setting the IsReadOnly property to true.

segment.source: You typically toggle this property in your app code based on conditions in your app.
segment.target: You typically toggle this property in your app code based on conditions in your app.

segment.source: If need text that is always read-only, consider using a TextBlock instead.
segment.target: If need text that is always read-only, consider using a TextBlock instead.

segment.source: You can make a TextBox read-only by setting the IsReadOnly property to true.
segment.target: You can make a TextBox read-only by setting the IsReadOnly property to true.

segment.source: For example, you might have a TextBox for a user to enter comments that is enabled only under certain conditions.
segment.target: For example, you might have a TextBox for a user to enter comments that is enabled only under certain conditions.

segment.source: You can make the TextBox read-only until the conditions are met.
segment.target: You can make the TextBox read-only until the conditions are met.

segment.source: If you need only to display text, consider using a TextBlock or RichTextBlock instead.
segment.target: If you need only to display text, consider using a TextBlock or RichTextBlock instead.

segment.source: A read-only text box looks the same as a read/write text box, so it might be confusing to a user.
segment.target: A read-only text box looks the same as a read/write text box, so it might be confusing to a user.

segment.source: A user can select and copy text.
segment.target: A user can select and copy text.

segment.source: IsEnabled
segment.target: IsEnabled

segment.source: Enable multi-line input
segment.target: Enable multi-line input

segment.source: There are two properties that you can use to control whether the TextBox displays text on more than one line.
segment.target: There are two properties that you can use to control whether the TextBox displays text on more than one line.

segment.source: You typically set both properties to make a multi-line text box.
segment.target: You typically set both properties to make a multi-line text box.

segment.source: To let the text box allow and display the newline or return characters, set the AcceptsReturn property to true.
segment.target: To let the text box allow and display the newline or return characters, set the AcceptsReturn property to true.

segment.source: To enable text wrapping, set the TextWrapping property to Wrap.
segment.target: To enable text wrapping, set the TextWrapping property to Wrap.

segment.source: This causes the text to wrap when it reaches the edge of the text box, independent of line separator characters.
segment.target: This causes the text to wrap when it reaches the edge of the text box, independent of line separator characters.

segment.source: NoteTextBox and RichEditBox don't support the WrapWholeWords value for their TextWrapping properties.
segment.target: NoteTextBox and RichEditBox don't support the WrapWholeWords value for their TextWrapping properties.

segment.source: If you try to use WrapWholeWords as a value for TextBox.TextWrapping or RichEditBox.TextWrapping an invalid argument exception is thrown.
segment.target: If you try to use WrapWholeWords as a value for TextBox.TextWrapping or RichEditBox.TextWrapping an invalid argument exception is thrown.

segment.source: A multi-line TextBox will continue to grow vertically as text is entered unless it’s constrained by its Height or MaxHeight property, or by a parent container.
segment.target: A multi-line TextBox will continue to grow vertically as text is entered unless it’s constrained by its Height or MaxHeight property, or by a parent container.

segment.source: You should test that a multi-line text box doesn’t grow beyond its visible area, and constrain its growth if it does.
segment.target: You should test that a multi-line text box doesn’t grow beyond its visible area, and constrain its growth if it does.

segment.source: We recommend that you always specify an appropriate height for a multi-line text box, and not let it grow in height as the user types.
segment.target: We recommend that you always specify an appropriate height for a multi-line text box, and not let it grow in height as the user types.

segment.source: Scrolling using a scroll-wheel or touch is automatically enabled when needed.
segment.target: Scrolling using a scroll-wheel or touch is automatically enabled when needed.

segment.source: However, the vertical scrollbars are not visible by default.
segment.target: However, the vertical scrollbars are not visible by default.

segment.source: You can show the vertical scrollbars by setting the ScrollViewer.VerticalScrollBarVisibility to Auto on the embedded ScrollViewer, as shown here.
segment.target: You can show the vertical scrollbars by setting the ScrollViewer.VerticalScrollBarVisibility to Auto on the embedded ScrollViewer, as shown here.

segment.source: Here's what the text box looks like after text is added.
segment.target: Here's what the text box looks like after text is added.

segment.source: A multi line text box
segment.target: A multi line text box

segment.source: Format the text display
segment.target: Format the text display

segment.source: Use the TextAlignment property to align text within a text box.
segment.target: Use the TextAlignment property to align text within a text box.

segment.source: To align the text box within the layout of the page, use the HorizontalAlignment and VerticalAlignment properties.
segment.target: To align the text box within the layout of the page, use the HorizontalAlignment and VerticalAlignment properties.

segment.source: While the text bBox supports only unformatted text, you can customize how the text is displayed in the text box to match your branding.
segment.target: While the text bBox supports only unformatted text, you can customize how the text is displayed in the text box to match your branding.

segment.source: You can set standard Control properties like FontFamily, FontSize, FontStyle, Background, Foreground, and CharacterSpacing to change the look of the text.
segment.target: You can set standard Control properties like FontFamily, FontSize, FontStyle, Background, Foreground, and CharacterSpacing to change the look of the text.

segment.source: These properties affect only how the text box displays the text locally, so if you were to copy and paste the text into a rich text control, for example, no formatting would be applied.
segment.target: These properties affect only how the text box displays the text locally, so if you were to copy and paste the text into a rich text control, for example, no formatting would be applied.

segment.source: This example shows a read-only TextBox with several properties set to customize the appearance of the text.
segment.target: This example shows a read-only TextBox with several properties set to customize the appearance of the text.

segment.source: The resulting text box looks like this.
segment.target: The resulting text box looks like this.

segment.source: A formatted text box
segment.target: A formatted text box

segment.source: Modify the context menu
segment.target: Modify the context menu

segment.source: By default, the commands shown in the text box context menu depend on the state of the text box.
segment.target: By default, the commands shown in the text box context menu depend on the state of the text box.

segment.source: For example, the following commands can be shown when the text box is editable.
segment.target: For example, the following commands can be shown when the text box is editable.

segment.source: Command
segment.target: Command

segment.source: Shown when...
segment.target: Shown when...

segment.source: Copy
segment.target: Copy

segment.source: text is selected.
segment.target: text is selected.

segment.source: Cut
segment.target: Cut

segment.source: text is selected.
segment.target: text is selected.

segment.source: Paste
segment.target: Paste

segment.source: the clipboard contains text.
segment.target: the clipboard contains text.

segment.source: Select all
segment.target: Select all

segment.source: the TextBox contains text.
segment.target: the TextBox contains text.

segment.source: Undo
segment.target: Undo

segment.source: text has been changed.
segment.target: text has been changed.

segment.source: To modify the commands shown in the context menu, handle the ContextMenuOpening event.
segment.target: To modify the commands shown in the context menu, handle the ContextMenuOpening event.

segment.source: For an example of this, see Scenario 2 of the ContextMenu sample.
segment.target: For an example of this, see Scenario 2 of the ContextMenu sample.

segment.source: For design info, see Guidelines for context menus.
segment.target: For design info, see Guidelines for context menus.

segment.source: Select, copy, and paste
segment.target: Select, copy, and paste

segment.source: You can get or set the selected text in a TextBox using the SelectedText property.
segment.target: You can get or set the selected text in a TextBox using the SelectedText property.

segment.source: Use the SelectionStart and SelectionLength properties, and the Select and SelectAll methods, to manipulate the text selection.
segment.target: Use the SelectionStart and SelectionLength properties, and the Select and SelectAll methods, to manipulate the text selection.

segment.source: Handle the SelectionChanged event to do something when the user selects or de-selects text.
segment.target: Handle the SelectionChanged event to do something when the user selects or de-selects text.

segment.source: You can change the color used to highlight the selected text by setting the SelectionHighlightColor property.
segment.target: You can change the color used to highlight the selected text by setting the SelectionHighlightColor property.

segment.source: TextBox supports copy and paste by default.
segment.target: TextBox supports copy and paste by default.

segment.source: You can provide custom handling of the Paste event on editable text controls in your app.
segment.target: You can provide custom handling of the Paste event on editable text controls in your app.

segment.source: For example, you might remove the line breaks from a multi-line address when pasting it into a single-line search box.
segment.target: For example, you might remove the line breaks from a multi-line address when pasting it into a single-line search box.

segment.source: Or, you might check the length of the pasted text and warn the user if it exceeds the maximum length that can be saved to a database.
segment.target: Or, you might check the length of the pasted text and warn the user if it exceeds the maximum length that can be saved to a database.

segment.source: For more info and examples, see the Paste event.
segment.target: For more info and examples, see the Paste event.

segment.source: Here, we have an example of these properties and methods in use.
segment.target: Here, we have an example of these properties and methods in use.

segment.source: When you select text in the first text box, the selected text is displayed in the second text box, which is read-only.
segment.target: When you select text in the first text box, the selected text is displayed in the second text box, which is read-only.

segment.source: The values of the SelectionLength and SelectionStart properties are shown in two text blocks.
segment.target: The values of the SelectionLength and SelectionStart properties are shown in two text blocks.

segment.source: This is done using the SelectionChanged event.
segment.target: This is done using the SelectionChanged event.

segment.source: Here's the result of this code.
segment.target: Here's the result of this code.

segment.source: Selected text in a text box
segment.target: Selected text in a text box

segment.source: Choose the right keyboard for your text control
segment.target: Choose the right keyboard for your text control

segment.source: To help users to enter data using the touch keyboard, or Soft Input Panel (SIP), you can set the input scope of the text control to match the kind of data the user is expected to enter.
segment.target: To help users to enter data using the touch keyboard, or Soft Input Panel (SIP), you can set the input scope of the text control to match the kind of data the user is expected to enter.

segment.source: The touch keyboard can be used for text entry when your app runs on a device with a touch screen.
segment.target: The touch keyboard can be used for text entry when your app runs on a device with a touch screen.

segment.source: The touch keyboard is invoked when the user taps on an editable input field, such as a TextBox or RichEditBox.
segment.target: The touch keyboard is invoked when the user taps on an editable input field, such as a TextBox or RichEditBox.

segment.source: You can make it much faster and easier for users to enter data in your app by setting the input scope of the text control to match the kind of data you expect the user to enter.
segment.target: You can make it much faster and easier for users to enter data in your app by setting the input scope of the text control to match the kind of data you expect the user to enter.

segment.source: The input scope provides a hint to the system about the type of text input expected by the control so the system can provide a specialized touch keyboard layout for the input type.
segment.target: The input scope provides a hint to the system about the type of text input expected by the control so the system can provide a specialized touch keyboard layout for the input type.

segment.source: For example, if a text box is used only to enter a 4-digit PIN, set the InputScope property to Number.
segment.target: For example, if a text box is used only to enter a 4-digit PIN, set the InputScope property to Number.

segment.source: This tells the system to show the number keypad layout, which makes it easier for the user to enter the PIN.
segment.target: This tells the system to show the number keypad layout, which makes it easier for the user to enter the PIN.

segment.source: ImportantThe input scope does not cause any input validation to be performed, and does not prevent the user from providing any input through a hardware keyboard or other input device.
segment.target: ImportantThe input scope does not cause any input validation to be performed, and does not prevent the user from providing any input through a hardware keyboard or other input device.

segment.source: You are still responsible for validating the input in your code as needed.
segment.target: You are still responsible for validating the input in your code as needed.

segment.source: Other properties that affect the touch keyboard are IsSpellCheckEnabled, IsTextPredictionEnabled, and PreventKeyboardDisplayOnProgrammaticFocus.
segment.target: Other properties that affect the touch keyboard are IsSpellCheckEnabled, IsTextPredictionEnabled, and PreventKeyboardDisplayOnProgrammaticFocus.

segment.source: (IsSpellCheckEnabled also affects the TextBox when a hardware keyboard is used.)
segment.target: (IsSpellCheckEnabled also affects the TextBox when a hardware keyboard is used.)

segment.source: For more info and examples, see Use input scope to change the touch keyboard and the property documentation.
segment.target: For more info and examples, see Use input scope to change the touch keyboard and the property documentation.

segment.source: Recommendations
segment.target: Recommendations

segment.source: Use a label or placeholder text if the purpose of the text box isn't clear.
segment.target: Use a label or placeholder text if the purpose of the text box isn't clear.

segment.source: A label is visible whether or not the text input box has a value.
segment.target: A label is visible whether or not the text input box has a value.

segment.source: Placeholder text is displayed inside the text input box and disappears once a value has been entered.
segment.target: Placeholder text is displayed inside the text input box and disappears once a value has been entered.

segment.source: Give the text box an appropriate width for the range of values that can be entered.
segment.target: Give the text box an appropriate width for the range of values that can be entered.

segment.source: Word length varies between languages, so take localization into account if you want your app to be world-ready.
segment.target: Word length varies between languages, so take localization into account if you want your app to be world-ready.

segment.source: A text input box is typically single-line ().
segment.target: A text input box is typically single-line ().

segment.source: When users need to enter or edit a long string, set the text input box to multi-line ().
segment.target: When users need to enter or edit a long string, set the text input box to multi-line ().

segment.source: Generally, a text input box is used for editable text.
segment.target: Generally, a text input box is used for editable text.

segment.source: But you can make a text input box read-only so that its content can be read, selected, and copied, but not edited.
segment.target: But you can make a text input box read-only so that its content can be read, selected, and copied, but not edited.

segment.source: If you need to reduce clutter in a view, consider making a set of text input boxes appear only when a controlling checkbox is checked.
segment.target: If you need to reduce clutter in a view, consider making a set of text input boxes appear only when a controlling checkbox is checked.

segment.source: You can also bind the enabled state of a text input box to a control such as a checkbox.
segment.target: You can also bind the enabled state of a text input box to a control such as a checkbox.

segment.source: Consider how you want a text input box to behave when it contains a value and the user taps it.
segment.target: Consider how you want a text input box to behave when it contains a value and the user taps it.

segment.source: The default behavior is appropriate for editing the value rather than replacing it; the insertion point is placed between words and nothing is selected.
segment.target: The default behavior is appropriate for editing the value rather than replacing it; the insertion point is placed between words and nothing is selected.

segment.source: If replacing is the most common use case for a given text input box, you can select all the text in the field whenever the control receives focus, and typing replaces the selection.
segment.target: If replacing is the most common use case for a given text input box, you can select all the text in the field whenever the control receives focus, and typing replaces the selection.

segment.source: Single-line input boxes
segment.target: Single-line input boxes

segment.source: Use several single-line text boxes to capture many small pieces of text information.
segment.target: Use several single-line text boxes to capture many small pieces of text information.

segment.source: If the text boxes are related in nature, group those together.
segment.target: If the text boxes are related in nature, group those together.

segment.source: Make the size of single-line text boxes slightly wider than the longest anticipated input.
segment.target: Make the size of single-line text boxes slightly wider than the longest anticipated input.

segment.source: If doing so makes the control too wide, separate it into two controls.
segment.target: If doing so makes the control too wide, separate it into two controls.

segment.source: For example, you could split a single address input into "Address line 1" and "Address line 2".
segment.target: For example, you could split a single address input into "Address line 1" and "Address line 2".

segment.source: Set a maximum length for characters that can be entered.
segment.target: Set a maximum length for characters that can be entered.

segment.source: If the backing data source doesn't allow a long input string, limit the input and use a validation popup to let users know when they reach the limit.
segment.target: If the backing data source doesn't allow a long input string, limit the input and use a validation popup to let users know when they reach the limit.

segment.source: Use single-line text input controls to gather small pieces of text from users.
segment.target: Use single-line text input controls to gather small pieces of text from users.

segment.source: The following example shows a single-line text box to capture an answer to a security question.
segment.target: The following example shows a single-line text box to capture an answer to a security question.

segment.source: The answer is expected to be short, and so a single-line text box is appropriate here.
segment.target: The answer is expected to be short, and so a single-line text box is appropriate here.

segment.source: Basic data input
segment.target: Basic data input

segment.source: Use a set of short, fixed-sized, single-line text input controls to enter data with a specific format.
segment.target: Use a set of short, fixed-sized, single-line text input controls to enter data with a specific format.

segment.source: Formatted data input
segment.target: Formatted data input

segment.source: Use a single-line, unconstrained text input control to enter or edit strings, combined with a command button that helps users select valid values.
segment.target: Use a single-line, unconstrained text input control to enter or edit strings, combined with a command button that helps users select valid values.

segment.source: Assisted data input
segment.target: Assisted data input

segment.source: Multi-line text input controls
segment.target: Multi-line text input controls

segment.source: When you create a rich text box, provide styling buttons and implement their actions.
segment.target: When you create a rich text box, provide styling buttons and implement their actions.

segment.source: Use a font that's consistent with the style of your app.
segment.target: Use a font that's consistent with the style of your app.

segment.source: Make the height of the text control tall enough to accommodate typical entries.
segment.target: Make the height of the text control tall enough to accommodate typical entries.

segment.source: When capturing long spans of text with a maximum character or word count, use a plain text box and provide a live-running counter to show the user how many characters or words they have left before they reach the limit.
segment.target: When capturing long spans of text with a maximum character or word count, use a plain text box and provide a live-running counter to show the user how many characters or words they have left before they reach the limit.

segment.source: You'll need to create the counter yourself; place it below the text box and dynamically update it as the user enters each character or word.
segment.target: You'll need to create the counter yourself; place it below the text box and dynamically update it as the user enters each character or word.

segment.source: A long span of text
segment.target: A long span of text

segment.source: Don't let your text input controls grow in height while users type.
segment.target: Don't let your text input controls grow in height while users type.

segment.source: Don't use a multi-line text box when users only need a single line.
segment.target: Don't use a multi-line text box when users only need a single line.

segment.source: Don't use a rich text control if a plain text control is adequate.
segment.target: Don't use a rich text control if a plain text control is adequate.

segment.target: \[This article contains information that is specific to Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps and Windows 10.

segment.target: For Windows 8.1 guidance, please download the Windows 8.1 guidelines PDF.\]
